title: Nigeria Prison Attack Frees 1,800 Inmates
sub_head: Raid by armed gunmen raises fears a new insurrection is building in a majority-Christian part of the country
body:
ABUJA, Nigeria—More than 1,800 inmates escaped from a prison in Nigeria’s southeast after it was attacked by gunmen on Monday, raising fears that a new armed insurrection is building in a majority Christian part of the country while the Muslim-dominated north is grappling with jihadist militancy and rampant criminal gangs.
Dozens of armed attackers entered the prison yard in the town of Owerri at around 2 a.m., according to local officials and eyewitnesses. The gunmen used explosives to blast open the administrative buildings and then opened the cells.
The assault, which lasted several hours, was among a series of coordinated nighttime attacks in which gunmen also targeted police and military facilities with rocket-propelled grenades and explosives in the capital of Imo state.
“We’re very afraid of what happens next,” said Blessing Iwe-Ajunwa, an Owerri resident who heard volleys of gunshots through the night. “Many prisoners have melted into the community.”
President Muhammadu Buhari said the jail break was an “act of terrorism” carried out by anarchists. He called on security forces to capture the attackers and the escaped prisoners.
